intro: Argythamnia haplostigma, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Argythamnia haplostigma is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
